results.title: BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report
results.text_hl: A 76-year-old man with a medical history of @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@, @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ stage 4 (@CHEMICAL_Creatinine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003404 @@@creatinine@@@ clearance of 29 ml/min/1.73 m2) and @<m>DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertension@@@ regularly taking @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 5 mg twice daily, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 25 mg twice daily, was admitted to the Emergency Department with lowered level of awareness associated with sustained @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@.

citations.NLM: Bailuni Neto JJ, Siqueira BL, Machado FC, Boros GAB, Akamine MAV, Cordeiro de Paula LJ, Rodrigues de Assis AC, Soares PR, Scudeler TL. BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report Am J Case Rep. 2022 Jan 21;23():e934600. PMID: 35058422
